msIdentifier.repository: Stofnun Árna Magnússonar í íslenskum fræðum, Reykjavík

msItem.author: Thomas Aquinas
msItem.title: Lauda Sion Salvatorem
msItem.note: Fragment of the Latin liturgical text with musical notation

msItem.title: Ólafsvísur
msItem.note: Fragmentary. Entire text copied out on AM slips

decoDesc.decoNote: Latin text accompanied by musical notation.

additions.p: Contains two slips in AM's hand. The first reads: Herra Kong Olaf hialpare Norex landa, / þer kom til handa / med helgum anda / eilif nad fyrer Jesum Krist; / heidr þinn mun um heiminn nordr standa, / þu komt oss bade ur kvolum ok vanda, / kender tru krapta ok list; / mustare klen / þu vigder væn, / villo kroten en miskun sen, / þu þat þat len / af guði igen, / herradæmi ok himna vist. / herra kong Olaf huggara ma þig kalla, þu lezt falla / forna stalla, / braust þu i sundr bolund hof; / refsa lezta ran ok stulde alla, / rettum domi villdar ecki kalla, / ok aflder þannveg Jesu lof; / logi kom raudr, / en uppgeck audr, / iafnan dom feck rikr ok snaudr, / þann la daudr / er þess var [traudr] / lydum þotti login vid of. / Herra kong Olaf hvar komu laun a moti, / þu eydder bloti / med oxi ok spioti, / bodadir ollum retta tru; / þegnar lanzins þola med engu hoti, / af þvi giordizt kurin lioti, / rikis folkit reidizt nu; / heyr ok se / hvat sart kann ske,

The second reads: þeir selldu þig fyrer mutu ok fe, / fals ok ve / kom folke a kne, / aumliga keypte olldin su. / Herra kong Olaf heimrinn ma þin niota, / þu vant at hliota / virding skiota, / vetrna fim ok fullan tog; / aller giordu þrendr upp at þiota, / þer i gegn bada hoggva ok skiota, / feingu þinu folke slog; / a Stiklastodum sem stendr skrif / med stale klavf þu buna hlif, / geck þu i kif, / ok gaf þitt lif, fyrer þau dyru drottins log. / Herra kong Olaf hiartanliga ma skyra / dauda hins dyra / Haralldar hlyra, liosit yfver hans likama skein; / bonden þann sem
A note in the margin of fol. 1v reads: ur latinskre messu saungs bok. bladit er komit frä Jslandi

origin.note: ON text dated to ca. 1500 by Kristian Kålund (Katalog, II:144). Latin text conjectured to be 14th c.

msItem.title: Margrétarvísur
msItem.incipit: faallda naunnu fogre litu þeir aungvan suannaa
msItem.note: Defective. Begins in the second stanza and ends in the middle of the 18th stanza.

msItem.title: Meyjarkvæði
msItem.incipit: Um heidurz mey vil eg hefiaa

additions.p: Inserted slip from AM reads: fyrra bladed þetta er ur Margretar visum. hverra upphaf er: Margret heiter mærenn biarta, er mina linar syndaparta, þad sidara bladed er um Mariam carminis initium ignoratur.

origin.p: Dated to the 16th century by Kristian Kålund (Katalog, II:144).

msItem.title: Boðorðavísur
msItem.incipit: Sialfur Gud firir sonar þyns naad

supportDesc.condition: Lower margin cropped with some loss of text.

origin.p: Dated to the 16th century by Kristian Kålund (Katalog, II: 145).

msItem.title: Hugsvinnsmál
msItem.explicit: ath liodum þessumm mega lyder nema. muna

origin.p: Dated to the 16th century by Kristian Kålund (Katalog, II: 145)

msItem.title: Píslardrápa
msItem.explicit: ok hardan rom aa efsta domi

origin.p: Dated to ca. 1500 by Kristian Kålund (Katalog, II: 145)

supportDesc.condition: Both leaves heavily worn and creased. Large holes at the top of both leaves have resulted in loss of text. The outer margin of fol. 2 is irregularly cut, though this seems to have occured prior to writing, and no text appears to have been lost.

decoDesc.decoNote: Floral drawing in the lower margin of fol. 2v.

origin.p: Dated to the 15th century by Kristian Kålund (Katalog, II: 145).
Dated to ca. 1500 by Kristian Kålund (Katalog, II:145)

msItem.title: Maríujarteikn
msItem.explicit: og hellt hon þa tueim hondum aa kertinu

msItem.title: Lilja
msItem.explicit: æ þackandi micle[?] miskunn min n

foliation.p: Foliated 1-2 in the upper margin of recto leaves

additions.p: Inserted AM slip reads: Af Eiriki vidförla. ur liliu

origin.p: Dated to ca. 1400 by Kristian Kålund (Katalog, II:146)

msItem.title: Barngælur
msItem.incipit: Kuedit er yfer bornum kuædi þetta
msItem.note: Kålund (Katalog, II:146) notes traces of earlier pigments which suggest that the parchment is a palimpsest.

additions.p: Inserted slip from AM reads: Fra Monsr Jone Widarlin elldra. 1725. Five lines (prayer?) and pen tests in a later hand on fol. 2v.

origin.p: Dated to ca. 1600 by Kristian Kålund (Katalog, II:146)

msItem.author: Einar Sigurðsson
msItem.title: Hjónasinna
msItem.note: Fragment. Contains the first 12 verses. Illegible.

additions.p: Inserted slip from AM reads: Þesse 2. innlógd blód voru samfóst i kiólnum. Eg skar þau hvert frä ódru, til ad þvo þad fyrra, med þvi eg sä, ad þad sidara ecki þolde vatned. Pen tests in the lower margin of fol. 1v.

origin.p: Dated to the 16th century by Kristian Kålund (Katalog, II:146)

msItem.title: Vísur um brúðkaupið í Kana
msItem.note: Possibly a palimpsest? (B/W photos seem to show lighter letters beneath the current text)
Photograph of partial transcription in AMI images folder.

origin.p: Dated to the 17th century by Kristian Kålund (Katalog, II:146)
